title: Card Security & Fraud Prevention

sections.title: Modern Security Features
sections.content:
Dealing with security issues is faster with modern apps. You can often solve problems yourself without calling the bank.

- **Freeze / Unfreeze**: Temporarily disabling your card from the app.
- **Virtual Card**: A digital-only card for safe online shopping.
- **Disposable Card**: A virtual card that is destroyed after one use.
- **Phishing**: A scam where criminals send fake emails to steal your login info.
- **Chargeback**: A request to your bank to secure a refund for a fraudulent or problematic transaction.
- **Compromised**: When your card or account details are no longer secure.
- **Limit**: The maximum amount you can spend or withdraw.

sections.title: Fraud Reporting Flow
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Notice Strange Charge] --> B[Freeze Card In-App]
    B --> C[Report Fraud via Chat]
    C --> D[Bank Investigates]
    D --> E{Fraud Confirmed?}
    E -- Yes --> F[Card Cancelled & Replaced]
    E -- No --> G[Unfreeze Card]
    F --> H[Funds Refunded]
```

sections.title: Past Simple: Investigating Issues
sections.content:
When reporting problems, we use **Did** for questions and **Didn't** for negatives. The verb stays in the base form.

**Negatives (Didn't + Verb):**
- *I **didn't authorize** this transaction.*
- *She **didn't receive** the verification SMS.*
- *We **didn't share** our PIN with anyone.*

**Questions (Did ... + Verb?):**
- *Did you **lose** your physical card?*
- *Did they **change** your password?*
- *Did the app **notify** you about the charge?*
